snippet: Pottery fragments found in a cave are 2,000 to 3,000 years older than examples found elsewhere, and probably came from simple concave vessels used for cooking food, archaeologists say.
abstract: Dr Ofer Bar-Yosef study in journal Science reports the discovery of fragments of ancient pottery in a cave in Jiangxi Province, China, that date back 20,000 years, making them the oldest known pottery in existence.
lead_paragraph: Pottery fragments found in a cave are 2,000 to 3,000 years older than examples found elsewhere, and probably came from simple concave vessels used for cooking food, archaeologists say.

headline.print_headline: Remnants of an Ancient Kitchen Are Found in China
headline.seo: Oldest Known Pottery Found in China
headline.main: Remnants of an Ancient Kitchen Are Found in China
